授業方法:
*The schedule listed below is indicative. The format, schedule, and content of graded assignments and classes, as well as the number of assignments, may change during the semester, depending on student needs.


This high-level, content-based class will include elements of lecture and seminar styles, and will be conducted face-to-face. However, assignments/homework/ assessments will be conducted, and lesson information/resources provided, on Google Classroom. As such, students will need access to a computer at home.

Short lectures will be given by the instructor each week. Students are expected to take notes, as these lectures will introduce the themes of the course. Supplementary readings will be assigned for homework to introduce additional information and deepen students’ understanding. Students will also do further research on these topics.

Students will have to regularly demonstrate detailed and critical understanding of the content of these lectures and readings, as they will form the basis of Written Responses (a kind of weekly test), group discussions, activities and presentations in the following classes. Lastly, students will have to create a research proposal, and then conduct and present an original research project on slang usage in their own context. The purpose is to develop the skills required to undertake a systematic inquiry into slang usage.

トピック.授業計画1: *Swearing 1,2: The content in these classes is for developing a functional understanding of English swear words, and is not intended for students' practical everyday conversational use.
トピック.授業外学習2:
- Most weeks you will read and analyse articles using a Reading Review Sheet. These support short lectures delivered in class, and form the basis for in-class Written Responses and discussions. This should take approximately 1 hour to 90 minutes a week.
- In addition, please review each lesson, and check any new content, language or skills learned. This should take approximately 30 minutes a week.
- Written Responses and active participation in class discussions are a big part of the grade for this course. Insufficient preparation outside class will severely affect your grade.
- Access any online material required. Some assignments may involve doing additional online research.
- In the second half of the course, additional independent work will be required on your slang research project. The time commitment will vary by week, depending on the individual project.
- Do not hesitate to contact me if you need any help, I’m happy to speak to you ( stringer@kwansei.ac.jp )
